The coccoid form and the recurrence of H. pylori infection The recurrence of H. pylori 93 94 cagA vacA cagA − vacA 95 96 97 H. pylori 98 Conclusion and future directions The coccoid form of H. pylori H. pylori Nevertheless, several critical questions remain unanswered. These include defining the precise conditions that facilitate coccoid resuscitation, disentangling the respective contributions of PGN remodeling versus TA systems, and determining the true prevalence of coccoids in recurrent infections. Emerging yet feasible tools – such as transcriptomic profiling via bulk RNA sequencing under defined stress conditions to characterize gene expression dynamics during coccoid transition and resuscitation, and organoid-based infection models that recapitulate the human gastric microenvironment to assess coccoid survival, immune evasion, and antibiotic tolerance – offer promising avenues to address these gaps. As a future direction, targeted therapeutic strategies could be developed to specifically disrupt coccoid formation, persistence, or resuscitation.
